intro: Pierreocarpus, commonly known as the African rock fig, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Moraceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, and thrives in rocky, arid environments. The plants are characterized by their thick, waxy leaves that help reduce water loss in dry conditions. They produce small, fig-like fruits that are edible and serve as a food source for various animals. Pierreocarpus species are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
